title: Airport cargo worth millions stolen from Toronto's airport
description: Canadian police say a cargo container with gold and other items worth over $20 million Canadian (US$14.8 million) was stolen from Toronto’s Pearson International airport

title: Biden administration to announce plans for anticipated border surge
description: Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas says the Biden administration will announce plans next week for the border after Title 42 ends in May.

title: Guatemala orders arrest of lawyers for imprisoned journalist
description: A Guatemalan judge has ordered the arrest of three lawyers defending jailed journalist José Rubén Zamora

title: Ukraine president calls leaders who stay neutral populist
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has taken a swipe at leaders who have adopted postures of neutrality regarding the Russian invasion of Ukraine, calling them populists

title: Ukraine defended Bakhmut despite U.S. warnings in leaked documents
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | Leaked top secret intelligence assessments show Washington warned Kyiv that defending besieged Bakhmut was costing too many casualties and would inevitably fail.

title: Ukraine planned attacks on Russian forces in Syria, leaked document shows
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | Last winter, Ukraine’s military intelligence directorate proposed striking Russian troops and Wagner mercenaries in Syria, before President Volodymyr Zelensky directed a halt to the operations

title: Russian foreign minister visits Cuba, condemns US sanctions
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov on Thursday condemned U.S. sanctions against Cuba, as he visited the island during the last leg of a Latin American tour that took him to Brazil, Nicaragua and Venezuela

title: Senior Malian official among 4 dead in ambush in jihadi area
description: Mali’s government says a senior Malian official and three other people have been killed in an ambush in an area of the country’s southwest

title: Muslims end Ramadan, begin holiday amid war, reconciliation
description: Large parts of the Muslim world are preparing to celebrate the end of the fasting month of Ramadan and the start of the holiday of Eid al-Fitr, but the festivities are overshadowed in many parts of the region by conflict and tragedy

title: Mexican airliner suffers engine failure, safely lands
description: The Mexican airline Viva Aerobus says one of its planes suffered an engine failure while covering a domestic route, but that the craft landed safely

title: Pope's cathedral 'regrets' Anglican ceremony on main altar
description: The pope’s cathedral in Rome has acknowledged that an Anglican bishop and 50 priests celebrated an Anglican service on the main altar in violation of the Catholic Church’s rules

title: India military: 5 soldiers killed in rebel ambush in Kashmir
description: The Indian military says five soldiers were killed when rebels fighting against Indian rule ambushed a military vehicle in the disputed Himalayan region of Kashmir

title: Runaway bull shot after charging through English village
description: Police say they shot and killed a runaway bull that charged through an English village as children were being dropped off at school

title: Texan princess evicted from Rome villa, Caravaggio stays
description: A Texas-born princess has been evicted from a historic villa in Rome containing the only known ceiling painted by Caravaggio

title: 320 Sudanese soldiers crossed into neighboring Chad
description: Chad’s authorities say at least 320 Sudanese soldiers have fled into their country amid fighting in Sudan

title: Netanyahu taps far-right minister for New York consul post
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has nominated a minister known for inflammatory statements and for waging a grassroots campaign against African migrants for the post of consul general in New York

title: Judge orders Tunisian Islamist leader to stay in custody
description: The party of influential Islamist leader Rached Ghannouchi says a Tunisian investigative judge has ordered him held in custody following his arrest on Monday

title: EU lawmakers greenlight migration plan, set clock ticking
description: European Union lawmakers have approved a series of proposals aimed at ending the years-long standoff over how best to manage migration

title: Singapore to resume executions after 6-month break
description: A Singaporean man is scheduled to be hanged next week for abetting an attempt to smuggle cannabis into the island-state

title: Families stream out of Sudan’s capital amid apocalyptic scenes of fighting
description: A humanitarian crisis is looming as people flee the fighting, but aid groups are also paralyzed by the urban warfare.

title: Sudan's truce falters, as Egypt repatriates army personnel
description: Egypt has repatriated dozens of technicians in its air force who had been held by one of the warring factions in Sudan

title: Greece: 1 migrant dead, 47 rescued after sailboat hits rocks
description: Authorities in southern Greece say one migrant has died and 47 others have been rescued after a sailboat crashed into rocks and partially sank in a remote coastal area of the Greek mainland

title: AP image of Mariupol hospital attack wins World Press Photo
description: Associated Press photographer Evgeniy Maloletka has won the World Press Photo of The Year for his harrowing image of emergency workers carrying a pregnant woman through the shattered grounds of a maternity hospital in the Ukrainian city of Mariupol in the chaotic aftermath of a Russian attack

title: Danes, Dutch to donate Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine
description: Denmark and the Netherlands plan to provide Ukraine with at least 14 refurbished Leopard 2 battle tanks to be supplied from early 2024

title: NATO chief visits Kyiv for 1st time since Russian invasion
description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg is visiting Ukraine for the first time since last year’s invasion by Russia, an alliance official says

title: Study: Climate change causing more 'heat stress' in Europe
description: A report shows Europeans, particularly in the south of the continent, are being subjected to more heat stress during the summer months as climate change causes longer periods of extreme weather

title: K-pop star Moon Bin found dead at home
description: Moon Bin, a singer from South Korean boyband Astro, has been found dead at his home in Seoul, according to his management agency

title: Indian climber who fell into deep Annapurna crevasse rescued
description: An Indian climber who fell into a 980-foot crevasse on Mount Annapurna on Monday has been rescued

title: Cattle raiding by jihadis soars in Mali, fuels conflict
description: Cattle raiding by Islamic extremists is soaring at unprecedented levels in Mali, with jihadis linked to al-Qaida and the Islamic State group stealing millions of dollars’ worth of cattle to buy weapons and vehicles to fund their insurgency across the war-torn West African country and region below the Sahara Desert, known as the Sahel

title: Ukraine live briefing: War survivor tells U.S. Congress about being forced to ‘dig my own grave’
description: A woman from Kherson told the House Committee on Foreign Affairs how she was tortured by Russian soldiers. The U.S. announced a new $325 million aid package for Ukraine.

title: South Korea’s gay couples fight for recognition, one law at a time
description: A court ruling allowing a man to add his male partner to his health insurance plan offers hope that change is possible in socially conservative South Korea.

title: Indonesia recovers bodies of 4 troops killed in Papua clash
description: Indonesian security forces have recovered the bodies of four government soldiers who were killed in a separatist attack while searching for a New Zealand pilot taken hostage by the rebels in Indonesia’s restive Papua region

title: Hong Kong bishop hopes for closer ties with Beijing diocese
description: Hong Kong’s Roman Catholic bishop says he hopes the dioceses of Hong Kong and Beijing will have more exchanges and cooperation

title: Mistaken address shootings echo killing of Japanese teen 30 years ago
description: The shootings of Ralph Yarl and Kaylin Gillis are sadly similar to the 1992 shooting death of Yoshihiro Hattori, which prompted international anger.
